entry.title: Switching It Up With HTML’s Latest Control
entry.summary: After years of relying on checkbox hacks to create a “switch” control for forms that toggle between two states, HTML may be gaining a native way to go about it by adding a `switch` attribute to checkbox inputs. Daniel Yuschick walks us through a first impression of switch controls and discusses current and ongoing considerations that need to be explored further before it is ready for prime time.

entry.title: Best Practices For Naming Design Tokens, Components And Variables
entry.summary: How can we get better at naming? This post is dedicated to naming conventions, tips, and real-world examples that help you name things in a robust and flexible way.

entry.title: Modern CSS Layouts: You Might Not Need A Framework For That
entry.summary: It’s easy to get lost in a sea of CSS frameworks and libraries, each promising easier styling and smoother layouts. Brecht De Ruyte demonstrates four CSS utility classes (plus a bonus) using techniques that allow them to be used practically anywhere you need a particular layout — be it Grid or Flexbox — with configurable options.

entry.title: Hidden vs. Disabled In UX
entry.summary: Should you hide or disable a feature? You’ve probably been there before. Here are some considerations for hiding versus disabling, along with possible alternatives to improve UX. An upcoming part of [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com).

entry.title: Building A User Segmentation Matrix To Foster Cross-Org Alignment
entry.summary: Many organizations prioritize internal structures and services over customer-centricity, hindering effective decision-making. Through a case study, Talke Hoppmann-Walton advocates for a shift towards an outside-in perspective and proposes the use of a user segmentation matrix to foster alignment across departments and prioritize customer needs.

entry.title: Beyond CSS Media Queries
entry.summary: Juan Diego Rodriguez explains why media queries still occupy a vital role in responsive layouts; only they are now one tool in a larger toolbox with modern techniques that are best when used together.

entry.title: Transforming The Relationship Between Designers And Developers
entry.summary: Is there such a thing as harmony between designers and developers in the workplace, and if so, how can it be achieved? In this article, Chris Day explores the challenges of effective collaboration, outlines the key factors at play, and (hopefully!) empowers you to find the right solutions to help you and your team deliver to their full potential.

entry.title: Why Designers Aren’t Understood
entry.summary: How do we conduct UX research when there is no or only limited access to users? Here are some workarounds to run UX research or make a strong case for it. An upcoming part of [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com).

entry.title: The Times You Need A Custom @property Instead Of A CSS Variable
entry.summary: Preethi Sam walks through an example that demonstrates where custom properties are more suitable than variables while showcasing the greater freedom and flexibility that custom properties provide for designing complex, refined animations.

entry.title: The Modern Guide For Making CSS Shapes
entry.summary: In this comprehensive guide, Temani Afif explores different techniques for creating common shapes with the smallest and most flexible code possible.

entry.title: The Forensics Of React Server Components (RSCs)

entry.title: How To Run UX Research Without Access To Users
entry.summary: How do we conduct UX research when there is no or only limited access to users? Here are some workarounds to run UX research or make a strong case for it. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.

entry.title: How To Harness Mouse Interaction Data For Practical Machine Learning Solutions
